questions.text: IV anesthetics are used for:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. IV agents have ultrafast action. They will make the patient unconscious with in one arm brain circulation time i.e., 15 seconds and that’s why they are preferred for induction Option: Opioids and ketamine (in selected situations) are used to achieve analgesia. Option: Total intravenous anesthesia (TIVA) as the name suggests, means only using IV agents, and is often employed for small-duration daycare surgeries. Ketamine because of its analgesic properties is utilized as a sole agent for select situations like burn dressings, pericardiocentesis, or incision, and drainage of the abscess.

questions.text: False regarding the following drug used for induction:

options.label: B
options.text: The patient gains consciousness because of the redistribution

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Can induce convulsions Thiopentone is a very strong antiepileptic. In fact, convulsions not getting aborted with other drugs may get aborted with Thiopentone

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Preferred percentage of thiopentone is 2.5%. Local complications of thiopentone are more if it is used in higher concentration . Option: B. The elimination half-life of Thiopentone is 10.4 hours but consciousness is regained after 10-15 minutes due to redistribution which means the drug from highly vascular areas like the brain is redistributed to less vascular areas like fat and muscle. Option: A. Thiopentone like other barbiturates can potentiate ALA synthetase leading to significant production, therefore is absolutely contraindicated in porphyria.

questions.text: A 22-year male has undergone a close reduction of the humerus. Anesthesia given was IV anesthetic. The patient became conscious after 15-20 minutes but the anesthetist asked him not to drive for 24 hours. Most probably the agent he used was:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Thiopentone The half-life of thiopentone is 10 hours, so patients are instructed not to carry any skillful activity for 24 hours but early regain of consciousness after 10-15 minutes occurs due to redistribution

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B, and Propofol, ketamine, and etomidate have a shorter half-life of 2-3 hours

questions.text: A patient on intravenous injection in antecubital fossa complained of severe burning pain in the forearm and hand. The most probable cause is:

options.label: B
options.text: Propofol is given at a faster rate

options.label: C
options.text: Diazepam is given at a faster rate

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Intra-arterial injection of thiopentone Thiopentone is a venodilator, therefore intravenous injection is not painful however intraarterial injection is painful; the patient complains of severe burning pain down the injection site.

Highyeild:

The chances of accidental intra-arterial injection of thiopentone is maximum if it is given in the antecubital fossa due to the proximity of the artery.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Propofol is an oil-based preparation prepared in soyabean oil, therefore, injection is painful however, pain is not so severe and will be in the upward direction not down the injection site as seen in intraarterial injection. Option: C, D. Diazepam is also an oil-based therefore can produce pain at the injection site however not down the injection site, and the pain is not so severe.

questions.text: Accidental intra-arterial injection of thiopentone causes:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vasospasm Vasospasm after intraarterial thiopentone is the main event that can even lead to gangrene.

Highyeild:

Due to the high alkalinity of thiopentone (pH= 10.4), it gets precipitated in the acidic pH of blood leading to crystal formation which causes endothelial injury inducing severe vasospasm leading to ischemia and even gangrene.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . It is the vasospasm that causes ischemia, not vasodilatation Option: Vasovagal is seen in the awake patient receiving some stimulus. In anesthesia vasovagal is usually seen during regional anesthesia Option: Usually there is endothelial injury. If neglected there may occur necrosis also but that’s rare

Extraedge:

Best policies to prevent intraarterial injection: Don’t use antecubital fossa for thiopentone injection Use 2.5% Immediately stop the injection if the patient is complaining of pain

questions.text: A patient is being operated on for cholecystectomy. Induction was done with thiopentone with a cannula in the antecubital fossa. The patient stated complaining of severe burning pain down the injection site. A diagnosis of accidental intraarterial injection was made. what should be the next best step

options.label: B
options.text: Stop thiopentone and start induction with propofol

options.label: C
options.text: Stop thiopentone and give lignocaine in the same cannula

options.label: D
options.text: Stop thiopentone and give lignocaine with adrenaline in the same cannula

questions.correct_answer: C. Stop thiopentone and give lignocaine in the same cannula
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Stop thiopentone and give lignocaine in the same cannula Lignocaine is a freely available and locally acting vasodilator therefore is used to relieve vasospasm occurring due to intraarterial injection of thiopentone

Highyeild:

Management of intra-arterial thiopentone includes: Leave the needle at the site Injection of vasodilators like papaverine, prazosin, phenoxybenzamine, and local anesthetics. Stellate ganglion block Heparin and later anticoagulants to prevent local thrombosis.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Needle or cannula must not be removed because all further therapeutic injections are given locally at that point Option: As we are giving heparin and continuing the patient on oral anticoagulants, elective surgery must be deferred for other dates. Option: Ischemia happens because of vasospasm. Giving adrenaline may lead to gangrene of the limb.

questions.text: Pentothal sodium should be injected preferably into:

options.label: C
options.text: Veins over the outer aspect of the forearm

questions.correct_answer: C. Veins over the outer aspect of the forearm
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Veins over the outer aspect of the forearm The dorsum of the hand does not have any nearby artery so is the best site for thiopentone injection. The second best site after dorsum of the hand is mid-forearm.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: Chances of intra-arterial injection of thiopentone is maximum when injected into the antecubital fossa because of the proximity of the ulnar artery. In 10% of subjects, there is an abnormal ulnar artery just below the antecubital vein further increasing the chance of arterial injection. Option: B. There are chances of injection into carotids. Spasm and thrombosis of carotids can cause massive infarct. Therefore, the neck vein must not be used for thiopentone injection Option: D. Femoral artery is just lateral to the femoral vein. Spasms and thrombosis of the femoral artery can cause lower limb ischemia

questions.text: Not a physical property of the following injection:

options.label: B
options.text: Color of the solution is white

options.label: D
options.text: Propofol acts on GABA and NMDA receptors

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Water-based preparation Propofol is an oil-based preparation containing soybean oil. Therefore, the injection is painful.

Highyeild:

Injection of Propofol is often preceded or mixed with lignocaine to decrease the pain of injection.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. It is available as a milky white solution as 1% and 2% solution. Option: C. It contains egg lecithin which acts as good culture media for bacterial growth; there have been death reports following the use of contaminated propofol solution. Option:D. Although Propofol mainly acts on GABA receptors however it also acts on NMDA receptors and Glycine receptors in the spinal cord

Extraedge:

A water-based preparation of propofol, Fospropofol was manufactured and used for some time then somehow got vanished from the market. Disodium edetate and sodium metabisulphite are added as antibacterial to prevent bacterial contamination however still there is a risk of contamination therefore, the propofol vial once opened should be discarded after 6 hours.

questions.text: Propofol is the most commonly used agent for induction in current-day practice of anesthesia. Which of the following is not the property of Propofol?

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence of nausea and vomiting is 5-10%

questions.correct_answer: B. Incidence of nausea and vomiting is 5-10%
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Incidence of nausea and vomiting is 5-10% Propofol is strong antiemetic. There are studies to prove that the antiemetic properties of propofol may be better than ondansetron.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A and D. Although Propofol antiepileptic activity has been well observed however it can cause Grand mal seizures and myoclonic activity. Option: Antipruritic properties for propofol have been well described at sub-anesthetic doses. It can be used to treat opioid-induced or biliary salt-induced intractable pruritis.

questions.text: Untrue about CNS effects of Propofol:

options.label: A
options.text: Excellent agent to be used for cerebral protection

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Although Propofol decreases ICT and metabolic rate of the brain but still can not be used for cerebral protection because it has been found to cause neuroapoptosis in animal models. Option: B. Propofol is a reasonably good bronchodilator, therefore is the IV induction agent of choice for controlled asthmatics. Option: C. Egg allergy is from egg white while propofol contains lecithin which is prepared from the yoke.

questions.text: A 38-year male is posted for extraction of the last molar tooth under general anesthesia as a daycare case. He wishes to resume his work after 6 hours. Which one of the following induction agents produces street fit person following surgery:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Propofol Street fit person means ready to go home. Propofol is the induction agent of choice for daycare surgery due to the following reasons The elimination half-life of Propofol is 2-4 hours All metabolic products are inactive eliminating the risk of post-operative sedation Due to the rapid redistribution, the recovery is very fast. Its antiemetic property makes the recovery to become very smooth.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Midazolam is the benzodiazepine of choice for daycare It is not used to produce induction. Option: C. Alfentanil was used as an opioid of choice for daycare surgery before the availability of remifentanil. However, opioids are used as an analgesic, not anesthetics. Option: D. Thiopentone because of its linger half-life is not preferred for daycare

questions.text: A 33-year male is going for lipoma excision. The anesthetist wishes to use LMA without using muscle relaxants. He will prefer to use which IV agent
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Propofol Among all iv agents, maximum inhibition of airway reflexes is seen with Propofol therefore, it is most preferred for laryngeal mask airway (LMA) insertion without the use of muscle relaxants.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Thiopentone does not significantly depresses the airway like propofol therefore insertion of LMA without muscle relaxant can induce laryngospasm or bronchospasm Option: C. Among the IV agents, airway reflexes are best preserved with Ketamine Option: D. Etomidate also does not depress airway reflex enough to allow insertion of LMA

questions.text: A patient in ICU was on sedation infusion for 2 days. He developed severe bradycardia and green coloration of urine. Blood gas analysis showed severe metabolic acidosis. The most probable agent would have been
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Propofol Propofol infusion syndrome occurs if propofol is used for > 48 hours.

Highyeild:

It occurs because of the failure of free fatty acid metabolism caused by propofol. It is associated with: Severe metabolic acidosis (lactic acidosis) Acute cardiac failure Cardiomyopathy Skeletal myopathy Hyperkalemia Lipemia Hepatomegaly The green color of urine is due to the presence of phenolic metabolites of propofol.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Thiopentone because of its very long half-life and hence the risk of accumulation is not used as an infusion in ICU to produce sedation Option: C. Midazolam is very commonly used to produce sedation in ICU however will not present with the picture of bradycardia, severe metabolic acidosis, or green coloration of urine.

Extraedge:

Propofol infusion syndrome is more commonly seen in children. Therefore, it is recommended not to use propofol as an infusion in children less than 16 years, and in adults, it should be used for > 12-24 hours as a continuous infusion.

questions.text: A 26-year female is to be operated on for an aneurysm of the brachial artery. The anesthetist would prefer to induce her with:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Etomidate Etomidate is the most cardiovascular stable agent among IV agents, therefore is the induction agent of choice for cardiac patients and vascular surgeries.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Thiopentone by causing venodilatation can cause hypotension therefore not preferred for cardiac patients or vascular surgeries Option: B. Ketamine stimulates the sympathetic system thereby can cause hypertension making it unsuitable for vascular surgeries. Tachycardia produced due to sympathetic stimulation can precipitate MI making it unsuitable for cardiac patients. Option: C. Hypotension seen with propofol is even more than thiopentone making it again unsuitable for cardiac patients or vascular surgeries.

questions.text: An intravenous anesthetic agent that is associated with hemodynamic stability, maintenance of cerebral perfusion pressure with postoperative nausea, vomiting, myoclonus, and risk of adrenocortical suppression
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Etomidate Etomidate is the most cardiovascular stable therefore best maintains blood pressure and hence cerebral perfusion pressure. However, among iv anesthetics incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting is highest with Etomidate (30-40%) Adrenocortical suppression is seen with generally seen with long-term infusion of Etomidate, however, can occur after a single dose too.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Ketamine is not cardiac stable but stimulates the sympathetic system it can cause tachycardia and hypertension Option: C. Propofol is also not cardiac stable, it can cause hypotension Option: D. Opioids can cause nausea and vomiting but not adrenocortical suppression

Extraedge:

Other disadvantages of etomidate are: Mycolonus Thrombophlebitis leads to painful injections in 10-15% of patients.

questions.text: Benzodiazepines are used in anesthesia for
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. One of the very important use of benzodiazepines in anesthesia is to produce sedation for procedures done under local anesthesia with monitored anesthesia care with sedation. Option: B. Benzodiazepines are being used to relieve anxiety as a part of preanesthetic medication. Based on personal choice and hospital policy anyone like diazepam, Lorazepam or midazolam (for daycare surgeries) can be used Option: C. Inadequate amnesia (patient can recall event) is one of the important reason for medico legal litigations against Therefore, Benzodiazepines should be used during GA to achieve amnesia particularly if inhalational agents are not used or used in limited doses due to hemodynamic instability or the medical condition of the patient.

questions.text: Midazolam is the most commonly used benzodiazepine in the intraoperative period in current-day anesthetic practice. All of the following is true about midazolam except.

options.label: A
options.text: It is preferred because of its short half-life

options.label: B
options.text: Injection of midazolam is less painful as compared to diazepam

questions.correct_answer: B. Injection of midazolam is less painful as compared to diazepam
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Injection of midazolam is less painful as compared to diazepam One of the advantages of midazolam is that it’s a water-based preparation therefore injection is painless while diazepam and lorazepam were oil-based preparations so their injection was painful

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The chief advantage of midazolam is its short half-life (2-3 hours) while that of diazepam is 36 hours thereby avoiding the risk of respiratory depression in post-operative period. Option: C. Benzodiazepines produces anterograde amnesia. Option: D. Numerous studies have proven the antiemetic effect of midazolam .

questions.text: Not an effect of benzodiazepines:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Analgesia Benzodiazepines are not analgesics however when given intrathecally they may produce analgesia by acting on dorsal horn cells of the spinal cord.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Benzodiazepines are potent anticonvulsants and are often used as first-line anticonvulsants to abort convulsions. Option: C. Benzodiazepines are centrally-acting muscle relaxants. Option: D. Like other hypnotics Benzodiazepines increase stage 2 but decrease stage 3, 4, and REM.

questions.text: A patient has come for the removal of small cystic swelling under local anesthesia with monitored anesthesia care with sedation. He wants to go back in the evening and is very much concerned about amnesia. The anesthetist would be preferring to use:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Midazolam The main advantage of midazolam is its short half-life (2-3 hours) making it as benzodiazepine of choice for daycare surgery. Moreover, Benzodiazepines produce anterograde amnesia.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Diazepam has very long half-life and produces active metabolites increasing the risk of pos-operative respiratory depression, therefore, can not be sued for daycare surgery. Option: C. N2O is not suitable for producing sedation and all inhalational agents produce amnesia except N2O Option: D. Because of the risk of apnea Propofol is not preferred to produce sedation. Secondly, it does not produce amnesia

questions.text: Shortest acting Benzodiazepine
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Remimazolam Remimazolam is an ultrashort-acting benzodiazepine with half-life around 30-40 min. It is still under phase III trials. It is metabolized in plasma by non-specific esterase.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Midazolam is short-acting however longer than Remimazolam; the half-life of midazolam is 2-3 hours Option: B. Diazepam is a very long-acting Option: C. Alprazolam is also longer acting (half-life around 10 hours) and is not available as parenteral preparation to be sued in the intraoperative period.

questions.text: Dissociative anesthesia is produced by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ketamine Ketamine inhibits the cortex to produce unconsciousness, inhibits the thalamus to produce analgesia, and simultaneously stimulates the limbic system to produce hallucinations and emergence reactions. This causes the patient not only to be dissociated from surroundings he/she gets dissociated from himself or herself.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: B, C, and D. Propofol, Etomidate, and thiopentone only cause loss of consciousness by inhibiting cortex. They do not cause stimulation of the limbic system, which means they do not produce the dissociative state.

questions.text: Which of the following anesthetic agent can be given by both intravenous and intramuscular routes?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ketamine Ketamine can be given by IV, IM, oral, intranasal, subcutaneous, and intrathecal (spinal) routes.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B, and D. Thiopentone, propanidid (IV anesthetic of past), or fentanyl-droperidol combination producing neurolept analgesia are given only through the IV route

Extraedge:

IM induction by ketamine is the second method of choice (the most preferred is inhalational) used for induction in children.

questions.text: All of the following are the properties of the following injection except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Muscle relaxation Ketamine does not produce muscle relaxation. In fact, it can increase the muscle tone

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Ketamine is a very potent analgesic (maximum analgesia among IV anesthetics) because it directly inhibits the Due to its analgesic property, it can be used as a sole agent for painful procedures. Option: C. Ketamine is such a potent bronchodilator that it can be used even for refractory status asthmaticus. Option: D. Tracheobronchial and salivary secretions are increased so atropine/glycopyrrolate premedication is necessary.

questions.text: With regard to Ketamine, all of the following are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is a direct myocardial depressant

options.label: B
options.text: Emergence phenomena are more likely if anticholinergic premedication is used

options.label: C
options.text: It may induce cardiac dysrhythmias in patients receiving tricyclic antidepressants

options.label: D
options.text: Has no effect on intracranial pressure

questions.correct_answer: D. Has no effect on intracranial pressure
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Has no effect on intracranial pressure Among all anesthetics maximum increase in ICT is produced by ketamine.

Highyeild:

It not only increases intracranial pressure but also increases intraocular and intragastric pressure. The increase in these pressures is because of its effect on increasing muscle tone. The increased muscle tone of abdominal muscles increases the intragastric pressure, increased tone of ocular muscles increases intragastric pressure while the increased tone of neck muscles obstructs jugular decreasing the venous return and hence increases the intracranial pressure

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Directly acting on the myocardium in the denervated heart depresses the myocardium but in a person with an intact sympathetic system, it stimulates the myocardium by stimulating the sympathetic system. Option: B. Anticholinergic (atropine only) can itself produce delirium (central anticholinergic phenomenon) while one of the major side effects of ketamine is also delirium Option: C. By causing sympathetic stimulation ketamine increases the possibility of arrhythmias in patients on TCAs (TCAs increase the level of catecholamines).

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy who has consumed milk 3 hours before is to be immediately operated for the removal of a sharp foreign body. The most preferred induction agent would be:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ketamine Ketamine preserves pharyngeal and laryngeal reflexes (although it does not guarantee 100% protection against aspiration). Therefore, most preferred agent for full stomach patients.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Among the IV agents, maximum inhibition of airway reflexes is seen with Propofol making it unsuitable for conditions with increased risk of aspiration. However, we are utilizing this property in daycare surgeries where are putting LMA without giving muscle relaxants. Option: C. Fentanyl is not used for induction Option: D. Although Thiopentone does not depress airway reflexes like propofol but still it can depress airway reflexes.

Extraedge:

Ketamine increases the intragastric pressure however not above the critical value of 20 cm H20 at which the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) becomes incompetent. In fact, an increase in intragastric pressure seen with ketamine can increase the tone of LES by reflex mechanism .

questions.text: A patient with antepartum hemorrhage (APH) with a BP of 80/60 mmHg is to be taken for LSCS. The anesthesia of choice will be:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

GA with ketamine Ketamine by stimulating the sympathetic system increases blood pressure making it an IV agent of choice for shock

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The most common side effect of spinal is hypotension therefore cannot be given to shock patient Option: B. Although epidural produces less hypotension than spinal still it produces hypotension and therefore cannot be utilized in shock patients. Option: D. Propofol by causing venodilatation can produce hypotension and therefore should be avoided in shock.

questions.text: Ketamine is the preferred agent for induction in all except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ventricular septal defect (VSD) VSD is left to right shunt. Ketamine by causing sympathetic stimulation increases afterload which will increase the shunt fraction in left to right shunts

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. In right to left shunts, ketamine by causing hypertension increases the afterload thereby decreasing the shunt fraction. In fact, the patient with tetralogy of Fallot are not only induced with ketamine, an infusion of ketamine is maintained to decrease the shunt fraction Options: C, and D. In constrictive pericarditis and CHF, cardiac output is mainly determined by heart rate, so ketamine by increasing the heart rate will maintain cardiac output.

questions.text: A patient operated on for a perianal abscess was found to be hallucinating and shouting in a postoperative ward. The agent probably used was:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ketamine Hallucinations are the most common side effect of ketamine and are seen in almost half (40-50%) of patients. Vivid dreaming is seen in almost 1/4 th of the patients. Post-operative delirium is also seen in almost one-third of the patients.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Thiopentone can also produce delirium however it’s a very rare side effect. Moreover, thiopentone does not produce hallucinations Option: B. Hallucinations has been reported with propofol but very rarely Option: D. Hallucinations and delirium is not seen in fentanyl

Extraedge:

Ketamine produces hallucinations, vivid reactions, and delirium because chemically it is a phencyclidine derivative

questions.text: Agent of choice for decreasing hallucinations after ketamine
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Midazolam Benzodiazepines are not only used to decrease the incidence of vivid reactions like hallucinations, they are the drug of choice for the treatment of vivid reactions. Among Benzodiazepines midazolam is almost always used in a current day practice.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B, and C. Opioids, barbiturates, Propofol, and inhalational agents, all have been found to decrease the incidence of hallucinations and emergence of delirium however the most preferred are benzodiazepines.

questions.text: Ketamine can be used for all except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

None of the above Ketamine infusion has been successfully used: Treatment of depression Chronic pain conditions like Complex regional pain syndromes Post-operative pain Opioid tolerance Opioid-induced hyperalgesia.

questions.text: Which IV anesthetic can be considered as a near complete anesthetic
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ketamine The basic triad of anesthesia is narcosis, analgesia, and muscle relaxation. Out of these 3 properties, 2 (narcosis and analgesia) are possessed by ketamine. Therefore, we can say ketamine is the agent near to completion.

Highyeild:

Advantages and uses Induction agent of choice for: Asthmatics. Shock. Low cardiac output states Right to left shunts An alternative method to inhalational induction in children through the intramuscular route Sole agent for minor painful procedures Can be safely used in remote places and in inexperienced hands Full stomach (pharyngeal and laryngeal reflexes are preserved). Disadvantages Vivid reactions Increases muscle tone. Increased Pharyngeal and respiratory secretions Increases myocardial oxygen demand. Increase in intraocular, intragastric, intracranial pressures

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Propofol only produces narcosis; its neither analgesic nor produces muscle relaxation Option: B. Thiopentone also only produces unconsciousness. At subanesthetic doses, it is rather an antanalgesic. Option: C. Etomidate also only produces unconsciousness

questions.text: µ (mu) receptors are responsible for all actions except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Diuresis Opioids don’t cause diuresis rather they cause urinary retention

Highyeild:

Opioid receptors are of 4 types -ì, |, ™, and Nociceptin ì- further divided into ì1 and ì2 ì1 – Analgesia, Bradycardia, sedation, Miosis, urinary retention, and muscle rigidity ì2 – depression, Constipation, Dependence | (Kappa) - Analgesia (mainly spinal analgesia but supra spinal also) Resp. depression constipation sedation Miosis Dysphoria Hallucination Dependence ™ (Delta) – Analgesia (mainly spinal but supra spinal also) Nociception (Orphanin FQ) Stress response Acupuncture

questions.text: After giving a drug combination for shoulder dislocation close reduction, the patient developed severe rigidity in thoracic muscles. The agent probably used was:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Fentanyl Fentanyl can cause severe muscle rigidity which can be so severe in thoracic muscle (wooden chest syndrome) that muscle relaxants may be required.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Thiopentone is not a muscle relaxant however it does not produce rigidity either Option: B. Propofol is not a muscle relaxant but it also does not increase the muscle too Option: C. Ketamine can increase muscle rigidity but not so severe that it produces wooden chest syndrome

Extraedge:

Muscle rigidity is not only seen with Fentanyl rather it is produced by all pure agonists. In fact, the maximum incidence of wooden chest syndrome is exhibited by Alfentanil

questions.text: Not a pure agonist at opioid receptors:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Buprenorphine Buprenorphine is a partial agonist

Highyeild:

Based on receptor interaction opioids are classified as: Pure agonist: Morphine Pethidine Fentanyl Alfentanil Sufentanil remifentanil. Agonist-antagonist mixtures: Pentazocine Butorphanol Nalorphine Nalbuphine Meptazinol Partial agonist: Buprenorphine Dezocine Pure antagonist: Naloxone naltrexone nalmefene.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B, and D . So, it’s well seen that pethidine, fentanyl, and morphine are pure agonists

questions.text: False statement about opioid and receptor interaction:

options.label: A
options.text: Morphine is an agonist at µ receptors.

options.label: C
options.text: Butorphanol is an antagonist at µ receptors

options.label: D
options.text: Nalorphine is an agonist at | (kappa) receptors

questions.correct_answer: B. Pentazocine is an antagonist at | (kappa)receptors
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pentazocine is an antagonist at | (kappa)receptors Pentazocine is agonist at kappa receptors

Highyeild:

All pure agonists are agonists at all receptors. All antagonists are antagonists at all receptors. Agonist-antagonists (except buprenorphine & Dezocine) are agonist | {and ™ (Delta)} up to a certain dose. After that dose, they are antagonists at µ receptors. Buprenorphine and dezocine are partial agonists at µ receptors up to a certain dose after that dose they are antagonists at mu (same) receptors.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Morphine is a pure agonist, therefore agonist is a mu receptor Option: C. Butorphanol is a mixed opioid therefore antagonist at mu rectors in high doses Option: D. Nalorphine is a mixed opioid therefore agonist at kappa receptors

questions.text: Which of the following has a ceiling effect:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Buprenorphine The main advantage of agonist-antagonist is that they produce a ceiling to respiratory depression i.e., up to a certain dosage there is respiratory depression due to agonistic action after that dose antagonistic action becomes more prominent.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B, and D. Morphine, fentanyl and buprenorphine are pure agonist. Therefore, respiratory depression and doses have got a linear relation; the higher the dose, the more will be the respiratory depression

questions.text: Respiratory depression is the major cause of death after opioid poisoning. All of the following statements regarding respiratory depression with opioids is true except:

options.label: A
options.text: There may occur a recurrence of respiratory depression after fentanyl

options.label: B
options.text: There may occur biphasic respiratory depression with pentazocine

options.label: C
options.text: There may occur delayed respiratory depression with epidural morphine

options.label: D
options.text: There may occur delayed respiratory depression with fentanyl

questions.correct_answer: D. There may occur delayed respiratory depression with fentanyl
questions.explanation:
Solution:

There may occur delayed respiratory depression with fentanyl Opioids are very frequently used through the epidural route to achieve post-op analgesia. They are deposited in epidural space while receptors are present in the spinal cord so, they have to cross the meninges to reach the spinal cord. Fentanyl has got high lipid solubility, therefore, crosses the meninges fast and that’s why does not accumulate in CSF to cause respiratory depression

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. After IV injection, all pure agonists are sequestered by the stomach. Reabsorption from the stomach can lead to the recurrence of respiratory depression. This is also called biphasic respiratory depression; 1 st phase of depression is due to IV injection and 2 nd phase is after absorption from the stomach. Recurrence of respiratory depression is only exhibited by pure agonists Option: B. Pentazocine is a mixed opioid therefore, will not exhibit recurrence or biphasic respiratory depression. Option: C. Due to low lipid solubility, morphine crosses the meninges slowly and gets retained in CSF to ascend to inhibit medullary centers leading to respiratory depression after 6-12 hours

options.label: B

questions.explanation:
Solution:

There is no tolerance for constipation Tolerance is seen in all actions of opioids except Miosis and constipation that is why opioid addicts remain chronically constipated.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Tolerance is not seen with miosis and constipation Option: B. Contrary to the previous belief that opioids tolerance is only seen after chronic use, it is very well proven that it can occur after acute use also (especially with remifentanil)

None of the above Although opioids cause spasms of the sphincter of Oddi to increase biliary duct pressure but this effect is considered clinically insignificant, therefore, if necessary, opioids can be used in biliary colic or pancreatitis.

questions.text: The opioid of choice for inhibiting stress response to laryngoscopy and intubation is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sufentanil Opioids blunt tracheal and laryngeal reflexes (that is why codeine is used as a cough suppressant) therefore used in anesthesia for blunting stress response to laryngoscopy and intubation. Sufentanil is most potent in this response.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Morphine can be used for blunting reflex response to intubation however it is not as potent as Sufentanil for this purpose. Moreover, the onset of morphine is slow, therefore not a suitable agent for this purpose Option: B. Pentazocine does not inhibit airway reflexes significantly Option: C. Alfentanil can also be used however again not as effective as Sufentanil

questions.correct_answer: B. It can be safely used through epidural for post-op analgesia
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It can be safely used through epidural for post-op analgesia Remifentanil contains Glycine which can cause motor weakness and motor weakness is not acceptable in post-operative period or painless labor, therefore, Remifentanil should not be used through epidural for post-operative analgesia or painless labor.

questions.text: Opioid of choice for treatment of shivering:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pethidine Shivering is a common occurrence in the intraoperative period. Pethidine is the drug of choice for the treatment of shivering. The exact mechanism by which pethidine abolishes shivering is unknown.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Tramadol is also effective in shivering and in fact, is more commonly used in India however it is not preferred because of its side effect which is mainly because of increased serotonin. Option: C. Remifentanil can rather increase the shivering Option: D. Fentanyl has been used but is not as effective as pethidine. Contrary to the previous belief that shivering increases oxygen consumption by 4 times, it is proven now that shivering doubles the oxygen consumption

Extraedge:

Contrary to the previous belief that shivering increases oxygen consumption by 4 times, it is proven now that shivering doubles the oxygen consumption.

questions.text: True about Methylnaltrexone and Naloxegol
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Reverses constipation Methylnaltrexone and Naloxegol (a pegylated derivative of naloxone) are classified as a peripheral antagonist because they reverse the peripheral side effects of opioids like constipation sparing central effects like analgesia. These are quaternary ammonium compounds and therefore do not cross the blood-brain barrier.

Highyeild:

The major side effect of an opioid after chronic use is constipation and unfortunately, there is no tolerance for constipation too. Therefore, to treat constipation it becomes imperative to stop opioids which can cause rebound pain in patients on chronic opioids leading to a very distressful situation. These peripheral antagonists have a very promising role in such patients

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A and C. Analgesia and respiratory depression are central effects of morphine therefore will not be reversed with methylnaltrexone and Naloxegol.

Extraedge:

Methylnaltrexone is given subcutaneously while Naloxegol is given orally.

questions.text: Which of the following is not cardio-depressive?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Etomidate Etomidate is the most cardiovascular stable agent among IV agents, therefore is the induction agent of choice for cardiac patients and vascular surgeries.

questions.text: IV administration of which anesthetic drug is most painful among the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Propofol Propofol is prepared in soyabean oil therefore injection is painful. The pain of injection can be reduced by mixing it with lignocaine

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Methohexital is a water-based preparation, so injection is painless Option: B. Ketamine is also a water-based injection therefore injection is painless Option: D. Etomidate is an oil-based preparation therefore injection is painful. However, the incidence of pain with Etomidate is far less as compared to propofol. Moreover, the new lipid preparation of Etomidate is lesser painful than its old propylene glycol-based preparation

questions.text: Ketamine is contraindicated in Hypertension Head injury Glaucoma Constrictive pericarditis Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, and 3 are correct Ketamine by stimulating the sympathetic system causes tachycardia and hypertension therefore C/I in hypertension Ketamine increases intracranial tension therefore C/I in head injury Ketamine increases intraocular tension therefore C/I for glaucoma It is beneficial in constrictive pericarditis because it will increase the cardiac output by stimulating the sympathetic system.

questions.text: Treatment of intra-arterial injection of Thiopentone: Injection of procaine into the artery Papaverine intra-arterially Heparin Stellate ganglion block Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, 3, and 4 are correct If there occurs intra-arterial injection of Thiopentone the needle should be left at the site because all therapeutic injections are to be given locally at the same site. The management includes: Injection of heparin 500 units to change the pH and prevent thrombus formation. Papaverine or other vasodilators like phenoxybenzamine, tolazoline. Xylocaine 1% (or any other local anesthetic) 10 ml. It will relieve pain and produces local vasodilatation. Stellate ganglion block (It will cause sympathetic block to cause vasodilatation)

questions.text: Which of the following drug can be used to antagonize morphine Naloxone Naltrexone Buprenorphine Fentanyl Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, and 3 are correct Naloxone is a pure antagonist of opioids and is most often used to reverse the side effects of opioids. The disadvantage of naloxone is its short duration Naltrexone is long-acting opioid antagonist therefore very useful for long-acting opioids like morphine Agonist-antagonists are antagonists at mu receptors at high doses therefore can antagonize the effect of morphine. Fentanyl is a pure agonist, therefore, will exaggerate the side effects of morphine

Unsafe drugs for porphyria Barbiturates- absolutely contraindicated Ketamine, Pentazocine, and Etomidate- should be avoided

questions.text: Ketamine can be used safely in all the situations: Status asthmaticus Burn dressing in the burn ward Aortic aneurysm Caesarean section Select the correct answer from the below code:

questions.text: Characteristics of Remifentanil: Metabolised by plasma esterase Short half-life More potent than Alfentanil Dose reduced in hepatic and renal disease Select the correct answer from the below code:

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true? After IV injection Buprenorphine causes late respiratory depression Morphine decreases the intracranial tension in head injury patients Fentanyl does not cause urinary retention All opioids cause bradycardia Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

None is true Pure opioid agonists (morphine, pethidine, fentanyl, Sufentanil, alfentanil) can cause late (delayed) respiratory depression after 3-6 hours due to 2 reasons: A significant amount is sequestered by the stomach which is reabsorbed into circulation. A significant amount is deposited in skeletal muscles, which is released into circulation with the onset of muscular activity after anesthesia. Opioids can increase intracranial tension in head injury due to direct cerebral vasodilatation. Urinary retention is quite common after opioids, especially after epidural All opioids cause bradycardia except pethidine, and pentazocine which cause tachycardia.

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true? Thiopentone is good analgesic Midazolam is moderate analgesic Tramadol increases serotonin levels Optimal concentration of thiopentone is 2.5% Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

3 and 4 are true At subanesthetic doses thiopentone is rather antanalgesic Benzodiazepines are not analgesic Tramadol not only produces analgesia through opioid receptors but also activates spinal inhibition of pain by decreasing the reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin The preferred percentage of thiopentone is 2.5%. Local complications of thiopentone are more if it is used in higher concentration, so 2.5% concentration is desirable

questions.text: Assertion: Ketamine is preferred for the patient with a high risk of aspiration Reason: Ketamine decreases intragastric pressure :

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reason are correct

options.label: B
options.text: Assertion is correct but the reason is incorrect

options.label: C
options.text: Both assertion and reason are correct and the reason is the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: D
options.text: Both assertion and reason are correct and the reason is the incorrect explanation of the assertion

questions.correct_answer: B. Assertion is correct but the reason is incorrect
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Assertion is correct but the reason is incorrect Ketamine preserves pharyngeal and laryngeal reflexes (although it does not guarantee 100% protection against aspiration). Therefore, most preferred agent for full stomach patients. On the other hand, ketamine increases intragastric pressure however this increase in intragastric pressure is also beneficial in decreasing the risk of aspiration. Ketamine increases the intragastric pressure but not beyond the critical value of 20 cmH20 at which the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) becomes incompetent. In fact, an increase in intragastric pressure seen with ketamine can increase the tone of LES by reflex mechanism.
